visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly quantitative values using Japanese numeric symbols (万/億) configuration in Highcharts
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains 12 monthly observations of a single financial metric, representing univariate time-series data. Synthetic values follow a bimodal distribution with peaks in June (17,600万) and September (21,640万), demonstrating intentional seasonality patterns. Data ranges from 2,990万 to 21,640万 (μ=12,513万, σ=5,892万) while maintaining integer consistency for financial reporting.

The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while preserving clear value markers. Cairo's pre-attentive processing is leveraged through consistent color intensity and proportional column heights. The Japanese numeric symbol implementation (万=10,000) follows ISO 80000-1 quantization standards, with formatted labels reducing cognitive load compared to raw integer displays. The bimodal pattern suggests potential Q2/Q3 operational cycles worth further investigation.
